temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.content: M. bovis and M. caprae are slow-growing bacteria and they need special culture media. Optimal grow occurs at 37°C. They are inactivated at the pasteurization temperature: 63°C for 30’ or 72°C for 15’’.

oxygen.title: Oxygen
oxygen.content: M. bovis and M. caprae are strictly aerobic but they are able to survive in the presence of CO2 < 10%.

ph.title: pH
ph.content: M. bovis and M. caprae can survive very acid pH, between 3 and 4. They grow optimally at pH between 5.8 and 6.9.

humidity.title: Water
humidity.content: M. bovis and M. caprae are able to survive in water up to over 200 days at 28-24°C (room temperature).

salinity.title: Salinity
salinity.content: Salinity concentrations > 3.0% inhibit the grow of M. bovis and M. caprae.
